head.title: Tamworth School District School District in Tamworth, NH. | GreatSchools

meta.name: description
meta.content: Information to help parents choose the right public school for their children in the Tamworth School District.

GreatSchools’ Summary Rating provides an overall snapshot of school quality. Ratings follow a 1-10 scale, where top-rated schools are "10s":

  • ratings between 1-4 signal “below average”
  • 5-6 indicate “average”
  • ratings of 7-10 are “above average”

GreatSchools’ Summary Rating provides an overall snapshot of school quality.
For some schools, we do not have enough data from state or national education agencies to provide a rating.

finances","finance.module_subtitle":"How a school district allocates funds can reflect its priorities. Learn more about how these decisions are made.","finance.parent_tip":"District decisions about how to spend money impact your child’s schooling. Here’s how parents can have an influence.","finance.RevenueSources":"Revenue sources","finance.ExpenditureSources":"Spending by category","finance.RevenueSources_tooltip_html":"This is a breakdown of how much of this district’s total annual funds came from federal, state, or local sources, compared to state averages:

Federal: Funds from the federal government, which can include money for Title 1 schools, vocational and tech education, bilingual education, and the Child Nutrition Act, and more.

State: Funds from the state government, which can include money for staff improvement, special education, gifted and talented, bilingual, and vocational education, school lunch, transportation, and employee benefits, and more.

Local: Funds from local sources, which can include money from parent organizations like a PTA/PTO; local property, sales, or utility taxes, and transportation, and more. ","finance.ExpenditureSources_tooltip_html":"This is a breakdown of annual district spending on preK-12 education and other categories:

Instruction: Spending on preK-12 instruction, including teacher salaries and materials for regular, special, and vocational programs during the school year and summer, and more.

Support services: Spending on administrative support for preK-12 education, including professional development, counselors, transportation, materials, and more.

Other preK-12 spending: Spending on preK-12 spending outside of instruction and support services.

Other spending: Other spending, including community services, adult education, and spending on things like buildings and roads. ","finance.data_types.Total Revenue":"Total district revenue","finance.data_types.Per Pupil Revenue":"Average revenue per student","finance.data_types.Percent Federal Revenue":"Federal","finance.data_types.Percent State Revenue":"State","finance.data_types.Percent Local Revenue":"Local","finance.data_types.Total Expenditures":"Total district spending","finance.data_types.Per Pupil Expenditures":"Average spending per student","finance.data_types.Percent Instructional Expenditures":"Instruction","finance.data_types.Percent Support Services Expenditures":"Support services","finance.data_types.Percent Other Expenditures":"Other preK-12 spending","finance.data_types.Percent Uncategorized Expenditures":"Other spending","finance.tool_tips.Total Revenue":"This reflects the total annual funds this district received from local, state, and federal sources, compared to the average across the state. (See examples below).","finance.tool_tips.Per Pupil Revenue":"This reflects how much annual revenue per student this district has compared to the state average. The revenue per student figure offers a helpful way to compare districts, since total revenues will vary greatly between large and small districts.","finance.tool_tips.Percent Federal Revenue":"This shows the share of this district’s revenues received from the federal government, which can include funds for Title 1 schools and programs like Safe and Drug Free Schools, the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act, vocational and tech education, bilingual education, and the Child Nutrition Act, among others.","finance.tool_tips.Percent State Revenue":"This shows the share of this district’s revenues received from the state government, which can include funds for programs including staff improvement, special education, gifted and talented education, bilingual education, vocational education, school lunch, transportation, employee benefits, and facilities, among others.","finance.tool_tips.Percent Local Revenue":"This reflects the share of this district’s revenues that came from local sources, which can include contributions from parent organizations like a PTA/PTO; local property, sales, or utility taxes, fees paid by students for textbooks, transportation, and school lunch, and revenues from rent or property sales, among others.","finance.tool_tips.Total Expenditures":"This is a breakdown of this district’s total spending, including spending on preK-12 education, adult education, payments to governments, private or charter schools, spending on buildings, roads, and equipment, and more.","finance.tool_tips.Per Pupil Expenditures":"This reflects how much money this district spent on a per-student basis, compared to the state average. This figure can help you compare districts to one another.","finance.tool_tips.Percent Instructional Expenditures":"This reflects the percentage of this district’s annual spending on teacher salaries, benefits, supplies, materials and other costs associated with preK-12 instruction, including regular, special, and vocational, programs during the school year and summer school.","finance.tool_tips.Percent Support Services Expenditures":"This reflects the percentage of this district’s annual spending on administrative, technical, and logistical supports for preK -12 education, including professional development, counselors, supplies, transportation, materials, and more.","finance.tool_tips.Percent Other Expenditures":"This reflects the percentage of this district’s annual spending on other preK-12 expenditures outside of instruction and support services.","finance.tool_tips.Percent Uncategorized Expenditures":"This reflects the percentage this district’s annual spending on programs not part of preK-12 spending, including community services, adult education, and on capital expenditures like buildings, roads, and other improvements.","academic_progress.toc_item":"Academic progress","student_progress.toc_item":"Student progress","top_schools.state_top_schools_header":"Best public schools in {state}","top_schools.top_schools":"Top schools","top_schools.top_schools_blurbs":"These are some of the top-rated public schools in {name} based on a variety of measures, including academic performance and equity. Click to see the full list of schools sorted by rating. About the GreatSchools rating ","top_schools.top_schools_test_score_ratings_blurb":"These are some of the top-rated public schools in {name} based on their Test Score Rating. Click to see the full list of schools sorted by rating.About the GreatSchools rating ","top_schools.csa_top_schools_blurb":"These are some of the best public high schools in {name} at preparing students for success in college. The College Success Award recognizes schools that do an exemplary job getting students to enroll in and stick with college, including those that beat the odds by better serving low-income students. ","top_schools.learn_more":"Learn more","top_schools.see_elem":"See more elementary schools","top_schools.see_mid":"See more middle schools","top_schools.see_high":"See more high schools"};gon.data_layer_hash={"language":"en","page_name":"GS:District:Home","City":"Tamworth","State":"NH","county":"Carroll","env":"prod","gs_badge":"CSAnullstate"};gon.facebook_app_id="112862918759431";gon.homes_and_rentals_service_url="https://www.greatschools.org/homes-and-rentals-service";gon.dependencies={"highcharts":"/assets/highcharts-995d8719f75b4db7a9a841f2715b6045.js"}; //

div.h2: Find schools in Tamworth School District

div.script:
{"summaryRatingData":{"key":"summary_rating","title":"District Summary Ratings","subtext":"How well are the students in this district doing compared to their peers across the state?","narration":"A worrisome sign:

A larger number of schools in this district are rated below average in school quality.

","tooltip":"

GreatSchools’ Summary Rating provides an overall snapshot of school quality based on multiple measures, like academics, equity, and the school environment, compared to other public schools in the state. In this section you can see a summary of the percentage of schools in this district with above, below, or about average Summary Ratings.

Learn more about GreatSchools Ratings. ","graphic_header":"How does this district compare with the rest of the state?","graphic_header_tooltip":"This chart shows the percentage of schools in this district with Summary Ratings that are above average (7-10), average (5-6), or below average (1-4) compared to state averages.","data":[{"key":"below_average","name":"Below average","value_label":"District","district_value":100,"state_value":41,"color":"#CB5C35"},{"key":"average","name":"Average","value_label":"District","district_value":0,"state_value":37,"color":"#AB8F0E"},{"key":"above_average","name":"Above average","value_label":"District","district_value":0,"state_value":22,"color":"#367A1E"}],"source":"

GreatSchools district data sources & information

The GreatSchools Summary Rating provides a multi-measured reflection of school quality based on the ratings components available for each school. To see how the Summary Rating was calculated for a school in this district, visit the school’s profile and click on the tooltip question mark next to the Summary Rating at the top of the page.

Summary Ratings for schools in this district were last updated on October 29, 2019.

Learn more about GreatSchools Ratings.
"},"district":{"districtId":172,"state":"NH"}}

{"title":"Academics","anchor":"Academics","subtitle":"Is this district offering opportunity for all its students, or leaving some kids behind? Successful districts are working to close the achievement gap. ","info_text":null,"icon_classes":"icon-pie","sources":"

GreatSchools district data sources & information

NH Statewide Assessment System

Reading, Math, Science

In 2017-2018, the state of New Hampshire administered the NH Statewide Assessment System (NH SAS) to students in grades 3-8 for English Language Arts and mathematics, and in grades 5, 8, and 11 in science. The NH SAS is a standards-based, computer adaptive test aligned to the NH Academic Standards.

Source: New Hampshire Department of Education, 2018

The NH SAS is a standards-based, computer adaptive test aligned to the NH Academic Standards.","test_label":"NH Statewide Assessment System","test_source":"New Hampshire Department of Education","year":"2018","state_number_tested":null,"grades":[{"label":"45","score":45,"state_average":44,"state_average_label":"44","percentage":"95","number_students_tested":null,"grade":"5","display_percentages":true},{"label":"35","score":35,"state_average":43,"state_average_label":"43","percentage":"95","number_students_tested":null,"grade":"8","display_percentages":true}]}]},"flagged":null,"title":"Science","anchor":"Science"}]}],"analytics_id":"Academics","showTabs":null,"faq":{"cta":"Notice something missing or confusing?","content":"

Missing a race or ethnicity? When the population of a student group is too small to provide reliable data, it does not show up in the display. This may cause certain races/ethnicities not appearing in some charts within this section.

How do we come up with the race/ethnicity labels? We display the language used by the State Department of Education to describe student races and ethnicities.

  • The “All students” number displayed represents the number of students who participated in testing.
  • The “% of students” information reflects the portion of the overall student population that each subgroup represents. For more about student demographics, visit the “Students” section below.

How do we decide which subjects to display? Test subjects shown represent those taken by the largest number of students.

Still have questions? Visit our FAQ page.

{"growthData":{"key":"student_progress","title":"District student progress","subtext":"How much are students learning in this district compared to the rest of the state?","narration":"\u003cspan class=\"emphasis\" style=\"color:#AB8F0E;\"\u003eWorth a deeper look:\u003c/span\u003e \u003cp\u003eStudents at many of the schools in this district are making \u003cspan class=\"emphasis\"\u003eabout the same\u003c/span\u003e academic progress as the state average.\u003c/p\u003e\n","tooltip":"\u003cp\u003eHow much do schools help students grow each year?\u003c/p\u003e \u003cp\u003eStudent progress (also known as “student growth”) is a way of understanding how well schools are helping individual students grow academically year-over-year, and whether these students are on track to meet their full potential, compared to students with similar proficiency levels at other schools in the state.\u003c/p\u003e \u003cp\u003eThe GreatSchools Student Progress Rating compares the academic progress over time for each school to all schools in the state, using student growth data provided by the state Department of Education. In this section you can see a summary of the percentage of schools in this district with above, below, or about average Student Progress Ratings.\u003c/p\u003e \u003ca href='/gk/ratings/#studentprogressrating'\u003eLearn more about this rating.\u003c/a\u003e\n","graphic_header":"How does this district compare with the rest of the state?","graphic_header_tooltip":"This pie chart shows the percentage of schools in this district with Student Progress Ratings that are above average (7-10), average (5-6), or below average (1-4) compared to state averages.","data":[{"key":"below_average","name":"Below average","value_label":"District","district_value":0,"state_value":27,"color":"#CB5C35"},{"key":"average","name":"Average","value_label":"District","district_value":100,"state_value":41,"color":"#AB8F0E"},{"key":"above_average","name":"Above average","value_label":"District","district_value":0,"state_value":32,"color":"#367A1E"}],"source":"\u003cdiv class=\"sourcing\"\u003e\u003ch1\u003eGreatSchools district data sources \u0026 information\u003c/h1\u003e\u003cdiv\u003e\u003ch4 \u003eGreatSchools Student Progress Rating\u003c/h4\u003e\u003cp\u003eThe Student Progress Rating measures whether students at this school are making academic progress over time based on student growth data provided by the Department of Education. Specifically, this rating looks at how much progress individual students have made on state assessments during the past year or more, how this performance aligns with expected progress based on a student growth model established by the state Department of Education, and how this school's growth data compares to other schools in the state. The Growth Rating was created using 2018 Student growth data from NH Dept. of Education.\u003c/p\u003e\u003cp\u003e\u003cspan class=\"emphasis\"\u003eSource\u003c/span\u003e: GreatSchools; this rating was calculated in 2019 | \u003cspan class=\"emphasis\"\u003eSee more\u003c/span\u003e: \u003ca href=\"/gk/ratings/#studentprogressrating\"; target=\"_blank\"\u003eAbout this rating\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\u003c/div\u003e"},"district":{"districtId":172,"state":"NH"}}

{"courses":[{"breakdown":"8th grade Algebra 1 participation rate","score":70,"label":"70","state_average":24,"visualization":"PersonBar","tooltip_html":"Most districts consider \u003ca href=\"/gk/articles/why-algebra/\"\u003eAlgebra 1\u003c/a\u003e an advanced course in grades 7 or 8 and a standard course in high school. This reflects the percentage of 8th grade students in this district who took Algebra 1 compared to the state average. Here's what you need to know about \u003ca href=\"/gk/articles/algebra-middle-school-math-track/\"\u003emath tracking\u003c/a\u003e."}],"sources":[{"data_type":"8th grade Algebra 1 participation rate","source_year":"2016","source_name":"Civil Rights Data Collection"}],"share_content":null,"title":"Advanced \u0026 STEM courses","titleTooltipText":"STEM stands for science, technology, engineering, and math. \u003ca href=\"/gk/articles/stem-in-the-classroom/\"\u003eFind out\u003c/a\u003e more about why STEM coursework is so important for today’s students.","subtitle":"A rigorous STEM course load can help students prepare for and get into college. \u003ca href=\"/gk/articles/stem-in-the-classroom/\"\u003eFind out\u003c/a\u003e more about why STEM coursework is so important for today’s students.","parentTip":"Many successful high school students end up in remedial math courses in college. \u003ca href=\"/gk/articles/ready-for-college-math/\"\u003eIs your student prepared\u003c/a\u003e for college-level math? Ask this district how they ensure students are well-prepared.","faqCta":"Notice something missing or confusing?","faqContent":"\u003cdiv class=\"emphasis\"\u003eAdvanced math in middle school:\u003c/div\u003e \u003cp\u003e\u003ca href=\"/gk/articles/why-algebra/\"\u003eAlgebra 1\u003c/a\u003e is typically offered as an advanced math course for students in middle school (it's a standard math class in high school). When information is missing in our display, it's most likely because the schools in this district either did not offer Algebra 1 to 8th grade students, or because the schools in this district did not have students in 8th grade. It may also be that the missing data was not included in the federal Civil Rights Data Collection (CRDC). (See \"Sources\" for more information.) Note\u0026colon; While schools in this district may offer Algebra 1 in 7th or 8th grades, we are displaying 8th grade Algebra 1 participation and pass rate information only, because the CRDC data set did not include pass rate information for 7th grade students.\u003c/p\u003e \u003cdiv class=\"emphasis\"\u003eAdvanced math and science in high school:\u003c/div\u003e \u003cp\u003eAdvanced Placement (AP) classes are rigorous classes with a final exam. The percentage of students taking AP classes may reflect whether the district culture is focused on college. When information is missing in our display, it's most likely because the schools in this district did not offer these courses.\u003c/p\u003e \u003cdiv class=\"emphasis\"\u003eWhy don’t I see AP pass rates?\u003c/div\u003e \u003cp\u003eWhen information is missing in our display, it may be because the schools in this district did not offer these courses or because the data wasn't included in the federal Civil Rights Data Collection (CRDC). Information about students taking and/or passing AP science or math exams is not part of the data provided by the CRDC. (See \"Sources\" for more information.)\u003c/p\u003e \u003cdiv class=\"emphasis\"\u003eWhat courses are included in \"Other AP course participation?\"\u003c/div\u003e \u003cp\u003e\"Other subjects\" include all AP courses other than those in mathematics and science. For example, AP computer science and AP world languages and cultures are included in \"other subjects.\" Note\u0026colon; a combined view of participation in any AP course can be found in the College Readiness module.\u003c/p\u003e \u003cp\u003eDid you find this useful? What can we do better? \u003ca href=\"https://s.qualaroo.com/45194/08c5c785-4c16-4a7a-9faf-434b253029bc\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eShare your feedback.\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/p\u003e \u003cp\u003eStill have questions? \u003ca href=\"https://greatschools.zendesk.com/hc/en-us\" target=\"_blank\"\u003eVisit our FAQ page\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n","qualaroo_module_link":"https://s.qualaroo.com/45194/6a8ccb75-0c22-4433-a220-97db8fd509df?state=NH\u0026school=172"}

div.h3: Recent school reviews from schools in Tamworth School District

div.span: This is an amazing school. I went from F's to A's from 6th to 7th grade .

div.span: Excellent School and Faculty. Could not be happier with our school.

div.p: Does your child attend a school in this district?

GreatSchools is the leading national nonprofit empowering parents to unlock educational opportunities for their children. We provide school information and parenting resources to help millions of American families choose the right school, support learning at home, and guide their children to great futures.
